title: Aural set, Golden Cockerel - excerpt description

content.description: You will hear two excerpts from an orchestral work. Each excerpt will be played twice. Then the two excerpts will be played once, with a slight pause between them. Before listening to the each excerpt for the first time, please read the questions.
content.question: Which of the following statements accurately describes the second excerpt?

choices.label: There is a tonic pedal point throughout.
The texture consists of a melody presented in canon.
Syncopation is a prominent rhythmic feature.
The excerpt concludes with a half cadence.

content.answer: There is a tonic pedal point throughout.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

topic.text: 6.3: Embellishing Tones - Identifying Anticipations, Escape Tones, Appoggiaturas, and Pedal Points

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
